filmography.title: The Ox-Bow Incident
filmography.role_description: A Mexican who, along with two other men, is wrongly accused of cattle rustling and faces a lynch mob.
filmography.plot: Two drifters are passing through a Western town when news comes in that a local rancher has been murdered and his cattle stolen, leading to mob justice.

filmography.title: Blood and Sand
filmography.role_description: A childhood friend and rival to the protagonist matador, representing the arrogant and successful side of bullfighting.
filmography.plot: An illiterate peasant rises to fame as a matador, but his passion for a beautiful aristocrat threatens his marriage and career.

filmography.title: They Died with Their Boots On
filmography.role_description: The legendary Lakota war leader who opposes General Custer in the events leading up to the Battle of the Little Bighorn.
filmography.plot: A fictionalized account of the life of General George Custer, from his days at West Point to his death at the Little Bighorn.

filmography.title: Viva Zapata!
filmography.role_description: The brother of revolutionary Emiliano Zapata, whose dissolute behavior and abuse of power contrast with Emiliano's idealism.
filmography.plot: Mexican revolutionary Emiliano Zapata leads a peasant uprising against the corrupt presidency of Porfirio Díaz.

filmography.title: La Strada
filmography.role_description: A brutish, strongman circus performer who buys a naive young woman to be his assistant and treats her with cruelty.
filmography.plot: A care-free girl is sold to a traveling entertainer, consequently enduring physical and emotional pain along the way.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Foreign Language Film

filmography.title: Lust for Life
filmography.role_description: The intense and arrogant painter who engages in a volatile friendship with Vincent van Gogh.
filmography.plot: The biographical story of the brilliant but tortured Dutch painter Vincent van Gogh.

filmography.title: The Hunchback of Notre Dame
filmography.role_description: The deformed bell-ringer of Notre Dame cathedral who falls in love with the gypsy dancer Esmeralda.
filmography.plot: In 15th-century Paris, the brother of the archdeacon plots with the gypsy king to foment a peasant revolt.

filmography.title: Wild Is the Wind
filmography.role_description: A Nevada sheep rancher who brings his deceased wife's sister from Italy to marry her, expecting her to be just like her sister.
filmography.plot: A rancher marries his sister-in-law after his wife dies, but she falls in love with his young ranch hand.

filmography.title: The Black Orchid
filmography.role_description: A widower who tries to romance a gangster's widow, played by Sophia Loren, despite the disapproval of their children.
filmography.plot: A widower and a widow plan to marry, but their children's disapproval threatens their happiness.

filmography.title: Last Train from Gun Hill
filmography.role_description: A powerful cattle baron who protects his son, who has raped and murdered the wife of his old friend, a U.S. Marshal.
filmography.plot: A marshal tries to bring the son of an old friend to justice for the rape and murder of his wife.

filmography.title: Warlock
filmography.role_description: A clubfooted gambler and gunman who is the devoted, possessive partner of a famous marshal hired to clean up a town.
filmography.plot: A famous gunman becomes the marshal of Warlock to end a gang's reign of terror, but his methods spark a conflict with his former deputy.

filmography.title: The Savage Innocents
filmography.role_description: An Inuit hunter who accidentally kills a missionary and is pursued by troopers across the Arctic.
filmography.plot: An Eskimo who has had little contact with white men goes to a trading post where he accidentally kills a missionary and finds himself being pursued by the police.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Nomination – Palme d'Or

filmography.title: The Guns of Navarone
filmography.role_description: A Greek resistance fighter who guides an Allied commando team, harboring a personal vendetta against the team's leader.
filmography.plot: A British team is sent to cross occupied Greek territory and destroy the massive German gun emplacement that commands a key sea channel.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Motion Picture (Drama)

filmography.title: Barabbas
filmography.role_description: The thief and murderer who is pardoned by Pontius Pilate instead of Jesus, and subsequently struggles with his conscience and faith.
filmography.plot: Pontius Pilate offers the crowd a choice of releasing Jesus or Barabbas. Barabbas is released and ultimately faces his own spiritual journey.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Foreign Film

filmography.title: Lawrence of Arabia
filmography.role_description: The powerful, fierce, and mercenary leader of the Howeitat tribe who aligns with Lawrence to capture Aqaba.
filmography.plot: The story of T.E. Lawrence, the English officer who successfully united and led the diverse, often warring, Arab tribes during World War I.

filmography.title: Requiem for a Heavyweight
filmography.role_description: A washed-up heavyweight boxer who faces the end of his career after being mauled in the ring, struggling to find dignity outside the sport.
filmography.plot: A knockout ends the career of a heavyweight boxer, who is then forced by his manager to wrestle.

filmography.title: Behold a Pale Horse
filmography.role_description: A corrupt Spanish police captain determined to capture a legendary guerrilla fighter who has returned from exile.
filmography.plot: A guerrilla leader abandons his life in France to return to Spain and avenge his mother's death, pursued by a police captain.

filmography.title: The Visit
filmography.role_description: A shopkeeper in a small town who becomes the target of his former lover, now the world's wealthiest woman, who offers a fortune for his death.
filmography.plot: A wealthy woman returns to her hometown and offers the residents a fortune if they will kill the man who seduced and abandoned her years ago.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Nomination – Palme d'Or

filmography.title: Zorba the Greek
filmography.role_description: A boisterous, life-loving Greek peasant who teaches a reserved English writer how to embrace life and dance.
filmography.plot: An uptight English writer traveling to Crete on a matter of business finds his life changed forever when he meets the gregarious Alexis Zorba.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; National Board of Review: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: A High Wind in Jamaica
filmography.role_description: A pirate captain who inadvertently captures a group of children, finding his crew's routine disrupted by their presence.
filmography.plot: Pirates capture a group of children who end up having a profound effect on the pirates' lives.

filmography.title: Lost Command
filmography.role_description: A tough French paratrooper commander who leads his unit from defeat in Indochina to the brutal conflict in Algeria.
filmography.plot: French paratroopers battle Viet Minh in Indochina and then Algerian National Liberation Front guerrillas.

filmography.title: The Shoes of the Fisherman
filmography.role_description: A Russian political prisoner who is released and unexpectedly elected Pope, trying to prevent a nuclear war.
filmography.plot: A Ukrainian Archbishop is released from a Siberian labor camp and eventually becomes Pope, trying to mediate a crisis between China and the US.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Win – Best Film

filmography.title: The Secret of Santa Vittoria
filmography.role_description: The drunken, bumbling mayor of an Italian town who rallies the villagers to hide one million bottles of wine from the retreating Nazi army.
filmography.plot: During WWII, the residents of an Italian village try to hide their wine from the Germans.

filmography.title: The Message
filmography.role_description: The courageous uncle of the Prophet Muhammad who becomes a warrior and protector of the early Muslims.
filmography.plot: The story of the birth of Islam and the life of Prophet Muhammad.

filmography.title: Lion of the Desert
filmography.role_description: The Libyan teacher turned guerrilla leader who fights against the Italian colonization of Libya under Mussolini.
filmography.plot: In 1929 Italy, Benito Mussolini appoints General Rodolfo Graziani to crush the Libyan resistance led by Omar Mukhtar.

filmography.title: Revenge
filmography.role_description: A powerful and ruthless Mexican crime boss who takes brutal revenge when his wife has an affair with his friend.
filmography.plot: A retired US Navy pilot comes to Mexico to visit an old friend, but falls for the friend's wife, leading to violent consequences.

filmography.title: A Walk in the Clouds
filmography.role_description: The patriarch of a Mexican-American vineyard family who upholds tradition and eventually accepts a newcomer.
filmography.plot: A married soldier returning from WWII poses as the husband of a pregnant woman to save her from her father's anger.
